item.title: Chicago Kids Unable to Bring Their Own Food to School
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Frell:

pwnd, you’re getting awfully defensive… did you used to be a little fatty?

projection much?

Frell:

Wow I fight for a child’s right to have a healthy life and you guys shoot that down also? None of you make any sense.

by taxing the parents? what will that accomplish?

Frell:

Im not saying fine the kids, Im saying fine the parents. Kids despise school and think the schools don’t know whats best for them. nonsense If a parent starts buying healthier food to avoid the fine then the child will slowly lose weight

just fyi, not everyone is fat simply because they eat unhealthy foods, and not everyone looses weight just because they eat healthy foods

Frell:

shut the fuck up pwnd, if my parents were letting me develop habits that would end my life sooner I would be pissed.

scumbag frell: criticize pwnd for being defensive, proceed to act defensive

also, projecting again? I don’t know, you decide! next on fox news…

[quote=“Frell, post:50, topic:390511”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=486423.msg3566091#msg3566091 date=1302657041]
If someone wants to eat themselves to death that is their choice, no one else has the right to choose for them.
[/quote]
If they’re too young to understand that their habits are killing them then the parents need to be held responsible.[/quote]

what about those big corporations that can afford to and do advertise on tv, printed media and can target younger generations? oh, and are allowed to sell such unhealthy foods in the first place? fuck them it’s the parents fault, fine the parents

Frell:

If the child is fat the PARENT isn’t doing their job, and the government doesn’t have to force them, but put a small fine on them every year as a nudge.

sounds like you’d prefer the government to spoon-feed your kids to me

Frell:

Awww mommy woves her wittle baby and wikes to give him watever he wants, have more cookies frelly!

projecting again… maybe

Frell:

Im guessing you’re for abortion too, aren’t you?

what does abortion have to do with childhood obesity? I tell you what abortion has to do with childhood obesity: absolutely nothing, you are an idiot

[quote=“Frell, post:54, topic:390511”]This kids parents should be fined:

perfect example.[/quote]

bombing countries with different values simply isn’t enough, now you want to fine the parents in these countries for raising fat kids! (hint: look at the text on the mcdonalds sign)

go and read mitbs post, obesity isn’t the only health risk children face

ps its not about shooting down the idea of you wanting kids to be healthy, its about you wanting to fucking fine the parents for something which can very much be out of their control

pps also, care to explain your first post? "They can’t punish the ones who know how to portion control, god damn. Its the parent’s problems. " which ones are being punished? it doesn’t make sense if you think the parents, or the school are being punished

final ppps babies born to overweight/obese mothers tend to have health problems later on in life, smoking and drinking while pregnant can cause harm to the baby, but fuck abortions right, who needs them?

Read full topic

item.title: Chicago Kids Unable to Bring Their Own Food to School
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Your all forgetting something here. Puberty. You hit it, you see someone you like. You start learning shit about life. You start to look after yourself, you aspire towards ‘gettin them bitches’. You lose weight, you get them bitches and you are happy.

If someone is too dumb to learn that eating so much that they become obese by the time they are 15, they are never going to be of any functional use to society and they deserve to eat themselves to death.

Don’t make laws banning food, ban advertisement. Put more stringent laws into action surrounding social welfare so fat jobless fucks will at least get off their arse and work for their food. It’s your life, do what you want. 12 years of over-eating wont damage you substantially, brainwashing will.

Read full topic

item.title: Chicago Kids Unable to Bring Their Own Food to School
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:52, topic:390511”]If the child is fat the PARENT isn’t doing their job, and the government doesn’t have to force them, but put a small fine on them every year as a nudge.

Awww mommy woves her wittle baby and wikes to give him watever he wants, have more cookies billy!

Thanks mom! (goes to run into the other room unaware that the eating habits his mother is teaching him could kill him)

Im guessing you’re for abortion too, aren’t you?

Also by fat I mean obese[/quote]Like I said, you don’t understand the principles of how this country should work, but you will argue for the country. I keep having to say the same things and you’re not understanding, so…

Perhaps you can tell the people who put fluoride in our water and aspartame and HFCS in our foods that they can’t do it because then parents will have a harder time “doing their job”. Kids aren’t supposed to be skinny anyways. They need some fat to grow into. Most of the time a person is overweight because of a medical/psychological condition anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Chicago Kids Unable to Bring Their Own Food to School
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I’ve previously said if a child is obese (for no medical reason).

Im talking about obese, like morbidly obese. Not chubby kids

This kids parents should be fined:

perfect example.

To let a child who doesn’t know any better practically start killing himself with horrible eating habits has to be child endangerment.

Read full topic
item.source: Chicago Kids Unable to Bring Their Own Food to School

item.title: Chicago Kids Unable to Bring Their Own Food to School
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:51, topic:390511”][quote author=Frell link=topic=486423.msg3566025#msg3566025 date=1302652951]
shut the fuck up pwnd, if my parents were letting me develop habits that would end my life sooner I would be pissed.

Let them be free once they know the consequences, until then the parents need to guide them.
[/quote]Yes, the PARENTS need to guide them, not the government. The most the government SHOULD be doing is teaching people better habits, not forcing them. You should be allowed to raise your child the way you want to. That is why they are under your custody and not in some child farm.[/quote]

Exactly!

Frell:

If the child is fat the PARENT isn’t doing their job, and the government doesn’t have to force them, but put a small fine on them every year as a nudge.

Why do you assume that if a person is fat they eat too much? They could also have some sort of disorder or disease, and not everyone is made to weigh the same, what is your definition of ‘fat’?

So you want a law about how fat a parent can allow their child to get, because it could endanger their health? What about a law about how long a child can watch TV? or play video games? or be on the internet? or how long they can exercise? how about how much sleep they get? Just about everything can be dangerous to your health if you do too much or too little of it. The danger here is when you can’t just legislate one and forget about the others, and they should all remain choices for the individual to make.

Read full topic

item.title: Chicago Kids Unable to Bring Their Own Food to School
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:32, topic:390511”][quote author=Frell link=topic=486423.msg3565087#msg3565087 date=1302576869]

They can’t punish the ones who know how to portion control, god damn. Its the parent’s problems. I personally think the parents should be fined small amounts if their child is overweight during checkups (for no medical reason).
[/quote]You’re a jackass. That would go against being free, still.

It doesnt matter, the child doesn’t know how dangerous being overweight can be, and if the parent is not helping that child it could cost the child their life. This does not make me a jackass.

It’s still a fucking retarded idea, taxing fat people, really?

No, fining their parents. Depending on how much they are overweight they should pay a $100-500 fine a year.

over the pond cigarettes are taxed through the roof, shops make very little money from selling them(5-7% profit compared to 20-40% on groceries), you’re not allowed to smoke them in bars/hotels/restaurants/public indoor places and the term used for cigarettes is fag[/quote]

Just to note, here cigarettes are taxed heavily as well, and in many states including Ohio where I live, you aren’t allowed to smoke in any restaurants, bars, or any other public areas either.

However, smoking is different than eating ‘unhealthy’ foods, since smoking near others forces them to inhale dangerous second hand smoke, where as what you eat doesn’t affect anyone else. If someone wants to eat themselves to death that is their choice, no one else has the right to choose for them.

Read full topic
